bioghist.p: The Rev. Dr. William Barrow Pugh (1889-1950 was a Stated Clerk of the Northern Presbyterians' General Assembly. He was awarded the U.S. Medal for Merit for his wartime services as chairman of the General Commission on Army and Navy Chaplains.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of William Barrow Pugh. Materials include: Stated Clerk correspondence, 1938-1948; correspondence documenting Pugh's service as a chaplain during World War I; a 526-page biography by Pugh's wife Emma Pugh; correspondence from Pugh to his wife during World War I; Pugh's Medal of Merit and certificate signed by Harry Truman; sermon notes, 1719-1727, of Timothy Edwards and Presbyterian and religious tracts published in the 1640s; photographs of Pugh and family; clippings of articles by Emma Pugh (from the Chester Times), 1950s; and memorials for Pugh. The collection also includes photographs documenting Pugh's travels for the FCC and General Commission on Army and Navy Chaplains during World War II; several bibles; and an illustration of the American Church in Paris. A scrapbook of materials collected by William Barrow Pugh, circa 1945, contains correspondence, articles, and biographical data on the Rev. William Henry Roberts.
